Crimes.Crime_Name: Failure to Comply with Parole Conditions
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Reasonableness of NPB's decision to deny temporary exemption from parole condition
Crimes.Governing_Law: Corrections and Conditional Release Act, sections 100, 101(a), 101(f), 133(6)
Crimes.Procedural_Stage: Judicial Review after Appeal Division upheld denial
Crimes.Evidence_Assessment: Exemplary behavior post-conviction, lack of police objections, past association with organized crime, inability to supervise abroad
Crimes.Burden_of_Proof: On applicant to demonstrate unreasonableness of NPB decision
Crimes.Credibility_Factor: NPB considered credible risks based on criminal history
Crimes.Legal_Rule: Public safety is paramount; conditions may be modified under s. 133(6) with adequate reasons
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Alleged procedural fairness and legal errors in decision-making
Crimes.Grounds_for_Claim: Speculative risk assessment despite good conduct
Crimes.Decision_Maker: National Parole Board (NPB), Appeal Division, Federal Court
Crimes.Review_Standard: Reasonableness standard applied to administrative decision
Crimes.Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: Court found no breach of procedural fairness
Crimes.Legal_Framework: Administrative law principles, statutory parole framework
Crimes.Applicant_Challenge: NPB failed to adequately justify denial based on speculative risks
Crimes.Legal_Rule_Source: Sections 100–101 of the Corrections and Conditional Release Act
Crimes.Standard_of_Proof: Balance of probabilities (implied in administrative review context)
Crimes.Defendant_Response: NPB emphasized public safety and risk management
Crimes.Remedy_Requested: Permission to travel to Italy under temporary exemption
Crimes.Outcome: Request denied; decision upheld on review
Crimes.Grounds_for_Inadmissibility_or_Allegatio: Potential reoffending risk due to organized crime ties
Crimes.Applicable_Process: Parole exemption request → Appeal Division → Federal Court judicial review
Crimes.Pending_Relief_or_Application: Temporary exemption from prohibition on leaving Canada

Crimes.Legal_Provision_Involved: Corrections and Conditional Release Act, sections 100, 101
Crimes.Procedural_Fairness_Issue: Adequacy of reasons and consideration of relevant factors
Crimes.Evidence_Disclosure_Status: Information from parole records and risk assessments disclosed
Crimes.Assessment_Factor: Risk to public safety, past criminal associations
Crimes.Evidentiary_Issue: Weight given to historical organized crime links vs. current conduct
Crimes.Procedural_Requirement: Board must consider all relevant information and provide reasons
Crimes.Risk_Nexus: Potential re-engagement with criminal networks abroad
Crimes.Evidence_Source: Parole file, law enforcement intelligence, applicant submissions
Crimes.Decision_Maker: National Parole Board, Appeal Division, Federal Court
Crimes.Basis_for_Decision: Unresolved public safety risks outweigh personal circumstances
Crimes.Legal_Framework: Statutory parole regime and administrative law standards
Crimes.Grounds_for_Inadmissibility_or_Denial: Risk of reoffending linked to prior organized crime involvement
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: NPB credited ongoing risk despite good behavior
Crimes.Procedural_Fairness_Issues: Allegation that decision lacked transparency and sufficient reasoning
Crimes.Accusation: Seeking unauthorized international travel during parole
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Alleged failure to properly weigh mitigating factors
Crimes.Credibility_Findings: Board found risk credible despite time served and compliance
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Whether NPB decision was reasonable and based on relevant information
Crimes.Decision_Level: Final decision by NPB, affirmed on appeal and judicial review

Crimes.Legal_Provision_Involved: Corrections and Conditional Release Act, sections 100, 101
Crimes.Procedural_Fairness_Issue: Sufficiency of reasons and fair consideration of applicant’s circumstances
Crimes.Evidence_Disclosure_Status: Parole documentation and risk evaluation provided
Crimes.Assessment_Factor: Public safety risk versus personal and humanitarian grounds
Crimes.Evidentiary_Issue: Reliance on past conduct versus current rehabilitation indicators
Crimes.Procedural_Requirement: Must provide reasoned decision aligned with statutory objectives
Crimes.Risk_Nexus: Potential reintegration into transnational drug trafficking networks
Crimes.Evidence_Source: Parole records, applicant submission, supervising officer report
Crimes.Basis_for_Decision: Ongoing risk of reoffending due to criminal background and lack of oversight abroad
Crimes.Legal_Framework: Parole legislation and principles of administrative law
Crimes.Grounds_for_Inadmissibility_or_Denial: Risk associated with organized crime history
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: Board credited potential risk over applicant’s clean record post-release
Crimes.Procedural_Fairness_Issues: Challenge to adequacy of explanation for denial
Crimes.Accusation: Violation of condition prohibiting international travel
Crimes.Credibility_Findings: NPB maintained presumption of risk based on offense gravity
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Legality and reasonableness of NPB’s refusal to grant temporary exemption
Crimes.Decision_Level: Final NPB decision confirmed through appeal and judicial review

Crimes.Legal_Issue: Reasonableness of NPB decision denying travel exemption
Crimes.Governing_Law: Corrections and Conditional Release Act, sections 100–101
Crimes.Procedural_Stage: Judicial review following denial and internal appeal
Crimes.Evidence_Assessment: Balanced exemplary behavior against persistent risk factors
Crimes.Burden_of_Proof: On applicant to show decision was unreasonable
Crimes.Credibility_Factor: NPB deemed reoffending risk credible due to criminal history
Crimes.Legal_Rule: Public safety paramount; modification allowed only if consistent with societal protection
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Allegation of inadequate justification and procedural unfairness
Crimes.Grounds_for_Claim: Decision based on speculative rather than concrete risks
Crimes.Decision_Maker: National Parole Board, Appeal Division, Federal Court
Crimes.Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: No procedural unfairness found by court
Crimes.Legal_Framework: Administrative law and conditional release statutes
Crimes.Applicant_Challenge: Overemphasis on historical risk despite rehabilitation
Crimes.Defendant_Response: Emphasis on statutory duty to protect public
Crimes.Remedy_Sought: Judicial intervention to overturn NPB decision
Crimes.Grounds_for_Inadmissibility_or_Allegatio: Potential for reoffending related to financial crimes and organized networks
Crimes.Outcome_of_Review: No error found in NPB decision
